columns.text: In this exercise, we are asked to retrieve the following values: ROE (Return on Equity), Net Income, and Equity Multiplier; for SME Company.

We are given the following values:


| | | 
|--|--| 
|ROA |7.9% | 
| Debt-Equity Ratio| 0.57| 
|Total Equity |$620,000 |

We are going to be able to retrieve these values using different ratios. First, we will find the ROE (Return on Equity). The ratio is computed with this formula.

$$ ROE = \frac{\text{Net Income}}{\text{Total Equity}} $$

Now we can express this formula as the product of two different ratios:

$$ \begin{aligned} 
ROA  & = \frac{\text{Net Income}}{\text{Assets}} \\[25pt]
\text{Equity Multiplier} & = \frac{\text{Assets}}{\text{Total Equity}} 
\end{aligned}$$

Notice that the Equity Multiplier can be calculated also as.

$$ \text{Equity Multiplier} = 1 +  \text{Debt-Equity Ratio}  $$

Now **ROE** can be calculated with the following formula:

$$ \begin{aligned} 
ROE & = ROA \cdot (1 +  \text{Debt-Equity Ratio}) \\[15pt]
& = 7.9\% \cdot (1+0.57)\\[15pt]
&=  \boxed{12.40\%}
\end{aligned}$$

The ROE is **12.40\%**

Finally, we can calculate the **Net Income** using the **ROE** formula again, and rearranging it:


$$ \begin{aligned} 
ROE  & = \frac{\text{Net Income}}{\text{Total Equity}} \\[15pt]
\text{Net Income} & = ROE  \cdot \text{Total Equity} \\[15pt]
& = 12.40\% \cdot \$620,000 \\[15pt]
& = \boxed{ \$76,898.60}
\end{aligned}$$

The Net Income is **$76,898.60**
